message_1: A student attempted to synthesize 20 grams of a compound, but only ended up with 15 grams of the compound after the reaction. Calculate the percentage yield of the reaction.
message_2:
To calculate the percentage yield of the reaction, we can use the following formula:

Percentage yield = (Actual yield / Theoretical yield) x 100

In this case, the actual yield is 15 grams, and the theoretical yield is 20 grams.

Percentage yield = (15 / 20) x 100 = 0.75 x 100 = 75%

The percentage yield of the reaction is 75%.
